author: James Cole
description:
Just your average day on Bournemouth beach', 'right?

Seagulls and arcade games and a cheeky ice cream', 'right?

Wrong!

Destiny’s come a-knocking and it wants your attention.

A strange boy with a rabbit', 'a collection of valuable objects', 'an alien conspiracy.

Immerse yourself in a race against time to find the objects and save the boy.  But beware', 'not all is as it seems and the Pathways of Destiny could lead you to adventure…or to ruin.

So', 'come on', 'tell me…which path are you going to choose?

Story © 2016 James Cole', 'All Rights Reserved.

Editors Charlie Hargood and Verity Hunt
name: The Pathways of Destiny

pages.content:
I can see that you’re completely caught up in your own little world.

You ignore everyone around you – the locals', 'the tourists', 'the students', 'all of them swarming to the beach like bees to honey', 'the golden sand like nectar.  You pay no attention to any of them.

Someone could walk past you offering a free lifetime supply of Haribo but you wouldn’t even look up. 

Because today', 'I can see', 'you’re a spy.

Yesterday', 'you were an astronaut (so over that) and last week you were a dinosaur (the less said about that the better).

But today you have decided to be a tip top', 'secret agent', 'double-O spy with an eagle eye trained on one mysterious boy.

A boy with a rabbit.

Not some kind of weird rabbit-shaped balloon or a life-size cuddly toy rabbit – he’s a bit too old for all that. 

But an actual real-life', 'fluffy', 'buck-toothed white rabbit on a lead.

You notice them standing by the carousel which is whirling and swirling with about three hundred REALLY noisy annoying kids.

And then you watch the boy', 'led by the rabbit', 'cross the promenade in front of the pier', 'over the water fountains – the rabbit clearly doesn’t care about getting wet – and into the Tourist Information Bureau.

But what was that?

Did he just...?

You could have sworn that before he disappeared inside the bureau he turned to look at you – right at you – and wave you over.

But that’s impossible because you thought you were being discreet.

You thought you were invisible - like every good spy is supposed to be.

But here he is again', 'popping his head round the doorframe and then…

Another wave', 'beckoning you over.

 

What would a spy do?

Would they follow the boy into the Tourist Information Bureau?

Or do you turn and leave', 'walking away to the Oceanarium as fast as you can?

hint.direction: Head to the front of the pier

pages.name: THE BOY WITH THE RABBIT

pages.content:
You turn around and walk – run – away', 'heading for the familiar comfort of the Oceanarium.

Scaredy cat. 

I knew you wouldn’t follow the boy.

You see there’s not much I don’t know.  I’ll let you in on a little secret but you must promise not to tell anybody. 

My name is Destiny but you can call me D. 

I see everything.  I read it in the stars', 'I read it in the sea.  None of this palm reading', 'crystal ball mumbo jumbo.  I’m beyond all that.  Look up: I’m in the sky', 'I’m beyond the sun.  Look out to the sea: I’m in its deepest darkest depths', 'I’m floating on the horizon.  Hear that?  That cry of the seagull.  That’s me too.  I’m everywhere', 'I’m in everything', 'I see and I know and I hear all.  Even things that haven’t happened yet.

And what I know right now – what I’m certain of -- is that if you follow that boy and his bizarre rabbit your life will never be the same again.  He’s still in the Tourist Information Bureau', 'waiting for you.

So go on.

Are you going to give up now and walk away?

Or are you going to follow him?  Aren’t you just a little bit curious?

hint.direction: Walk away to the oceanarium...

pages.name: WALK AWAY

pages.content:
Well done!  You’ve done the right thing.

I knew you would follow the boy.

You see there’s not much I don’t know.  I’ll let you in on a little secret but you must promise not to tell anybody. 

My name is Destiny but you can call me D. 

I see everything.  I read it in the stars', 'I read it in the sea.  None of this palm reading', 'crystal ball mumbo jumbo.  I’m beyond all that.  Look up: I’m in the sky', 'I’m beyond the sun.  Look out to the sea: I’m in its deepest darkest depths', 'I’m floating on the horizon.  Hear that?  That cry of the seagull.  That’s me too.  I’m everywhere', 'I’m in everything', 'I see and I know and I hear all.  Even things that haven’t happened yet.

And what I know right now – what I’m certain of -- is that if you follow that boy and his bizarre rabbit your life will never be the same again.  He’s still in the Tourist Information Bureau', 'waiting for you.

So go on.  Head over.

What are you waiting for?

hint.direction: To the front of the pier

pages.name: FOLLOW

pages.content:
Good choice.

Who knows what adventures will await you as you follow the boy with the rabbit through the door?  Well', 'actually I do - they don’t call me Destiny for no reason - but I’m going to let you figure this one out for yourself.  I’m going to take a bit of a back seat for a while', 'so to speak – no one likes a backseat driver.

For once', 'I’m not going to interfere.  Oh', 'I’m going to be here watching', 'don’t you worry about that – curiosity is in my very nature - but this adventure is yours.  The only thing I will say is that there are going to be many paths before you', 'so remember…choose wisely.

So…here goes…

Ignore the leaflets', 'ignore the staff', 'ignore the tourists.

Focus on the boy with the rabbit.  He’s in the corner', 'looking out over the pier and the sea.

Go over to him.  Go on', 'I know you’re feeling brave.

He turns to look at you and you can’t help feeling he’s got such a sad face.  As if he’s lost something important.  Or as if he’s the loneliest boy in the world.  The rabbit’s scared too', 'no longer on its lead', 'it’s half-cowering under the boy’s arm', 'inside his jacket which is the same colour aquamarine as the sea.

But it’s the boy that’s got your full attention because', 'out of the blue', 'he says', '“I need your help.  Will you help me?”

What are you going to say?

“No', 'I don’t talk to strangers...” or “What is it you need?”

hint.direction: Follow him to outside the tourist information office

pages.name: THE PATHS BEFORE YOU

pages.content:
I know I promised to take a step back but I’ve got to be honest and say I’m beginning to lose faith in you.  How can you say that to such a sad looking boy?  You’ve broken his heart', 'can’t you see in the way his upper lip quivers?  And look how those puppy-dog eyes are filling with tears?

Fine', 'if that’s your attitude', 'I don’t think you’re the right kind of person for this mission anyway.  I will find someone else', 'someone far more worthy.  You just go back to living your comfortable life and forget this ever happened.

Although beware', 'I’m telling you now that you have no idea what you just missed out on.

To be fair', 'you should never talk to strangers so you do have a point.

But maybe this once', 'you could help out the boy with the rabbit and the sad eyes.  I promise you won’t come to harm.

Maybe you could just ask what the boy needs and then make your decision.  Come on', 'what’s the worst thing that could happen?

hint.direction: Outside Tourist Information

pages.name: 'NO', 'I DON’T TALK TO STRANGERS'

pages.content:
The boy’s face lights up', 'as if you’ve just given him a gazillion pounds.

He talks in an excited whisper', 'making sure that no one else can hear.  “My name is Zlippyparf.”  You try not to laugh at his name which sounds like what you might call a farting fish.  You let him continue.  “But you can call me Zlip.  You can’t tell anyone but I’m not from around here.  You see', 'I’m from another planet.  My spaceship crash-landed out there.”  He points to somewhere beyond the end of the pier but all you can see is the point where the sea meets the sky - no sign of an alien spacecraft unless…

Wait!  What’s that? 

Oh', 'it’s just a seagull. 

Zlip continues his story: “I managed to escape before the ship crashed and I had to swim ashore.  There’s no way I can find my ship again but there’s another ship –the mothership - in orbit.  My only problem is that my communication system was damaged when I landed in the water and I have no way of contacting them.  Well…there is one way.  And that’s where you come in.  During the crash', 'some of my cargo was spread around the local area', 'specifically seven Info-Pads which run on their own battery packs.  If I can collect them', 'I could create a quantum beacon that will let the mothership know where I am.”

So there you have it.  The boy needs you to find his cargo and you’ve already promised him you’ll help so you can’t turn back now', 'it wouldn’t be right.

But rooting around finding cargo is not really the job of a spy', 'is it?  Maybe today', 'for this mission', 'you need to be something else?

So tell me', 'who are you going to be?

A geologist.  An Archaeologist.  An Egyptologist.  A Naturalist.  An Ornithologist.  A Historian. A Palaeontologist.

The choice is yours.

hint.direction: Outside Tourist Information

pages.name: 'WHAT IS IT YOU NEED?'

pages.content:
Ah geology: the study of the Earth and how it changes.  But you already knew that', 'didn’t you?

Gems', 'rocks', 'sand', 'minerals', 'tectonic plates - Earth’s treasure trove and a geologist’s dream. 

Look down!  Beyond your feet the earth’s solid core is nearly 4000 miles below you.  I’d say I’d take you there one day but it’s a little...hot.

For now', 'let’s just stick to Bournemouth', 'shall we?

Zlip seems wary', 'he keeps looking around him like he’s being watched.  You ask him if he’s OK.

“There’s something I haven’t told you,” he says', 'looking nervous.  “The reason I crashed is because I’m being hunted by an evil woman called Emanax.  She’s the one that shot down my ship and I bet she’s still out there', 'looking for me', 'hunting me.  I’ll explain more as we go but we’re going to have to be quick and we’re going to have to be careful.”

You say that you’re not afraid of some alien because you’re way too cool for that and so you ask Zlip more about what you need to do.

“If we can find the seven Info-Pads that were lost from my ship then I can combine their battery packs to my communication device and set off the quantum beacon.  They’re out there somewhere', 'we just need to find them.  Before Emanax finds us.  You know this area better than I do.  Where shall we look first?”

hint.direction: Outside Tourist Information

pages.name: THE GEOLOGIST

pages.content:
No sign of Emanax…yet.  But you can’t help shake the feeling that you’re being watched.  Luckily', 'it doesn’t take you long to find the Info-Pad perched precariously between the wooden slats of the pier.  Before Zlip pockets it', 'he lets you read it.

 

INFO-PAD: MALACHITE

  • Copper carbonate hydroxide mineral
  • Given name due to resemblance to leaves of mallow plant
  • Has been used as an ornamental stone and a gemstone

 

“It’s amazing,” says Zlip.  “Don’t you think it’s beautiful?  It’s the same green-blue of the sea.  We don’t have anything on our world like this', 'nothing even comes close.  Our most precious stone kind of looks like one of your pebbles', 'all grey and boring.  You must think my planet’s pretty strange.” 

You say it had crossed your mind and you think now’s as good a time as any to talk about the elephant in the room.

Well', 'not an elephant', 'but the rabbit. 

“This is Zlartybox', 'my pet.  I found him on Planet DNKA IV.  During the battle with Emanax', 'I realised that if we had to evacuate the ship', 'Zlartybox and I would stand out a bit so I programmed these Shifter collars.”  He points to the silver collar around his neck and you see that the rabbit has one too.  “It lets us take on a different form.  I thought Zlartybox would be particularly conspicuous in Bournemouth because he’s an eight-foot', 'blue-skinned', 'nine-legged Tokai Creature with six horns on his forehead.  I thought he might be somewhat noticeable.  So I chose an everyday kind of Earth animal for him to change into.  Although people keep looking at me.  Do you not take your rabbits for walks?” 

You shake your head.  “Oh,” says Zlip.

Suddenly', 'the rabbit’s ears prick up and Zlip looks around.  You can’t hear anything but the sound of the waves and the odd seagull but Zlip is definitely spooked.  “Emanax is close.  Zlartybox can sense her.  We’d better hurry!”

hint.direction: At the front of the pier

pages.name: PIER RABBIT

pages.content:
The next Info-Pad is partially hidden underneath one of the benches near to the balloon.

INFO-PAD: AZURITE

  • Soft', 'deep-blue copper mineral
  • Bright light', 'heat and open air reduce the intensity of its colour over time
  • Was used as pigment in paint since antiquity

 

As you look up', 'the balloon nearly blocks out the whole sun as if it’s a stray planet that’s come too close to Earth.  “My spaceship used to look a bit like that,” says Zlip.  Only it wasn’t powered by gas and air.  It was powered by grgyoxxineutrino particle emissions which comes from a precious stone on the planet Govanor.  It looks a bit like Azurite now I come to think about it – deep blue', 'like the sky on a winter’s evening.”

You tell Zlip that you’d better get a move on but he seems transfixed by the balloon.  “It’s a magical feeling', 'soaring high above planet Earth.  I’ve visited the ice caps of Antarctica and the deserts of Africa.  I’ve hovered high over the mountains of the Himalayas and down low over the mangrove forests of Pakistan.  I’ve also been to Boscombe.  Interesting place.  Have you been up in the balloon?  If you haven’t', 'and you get a chance to go', 'maybe you could imagine that you’re with me in my spaceship', 'seeing as far as the Isle of Wight on one side', 'and the Purbecks on the other.”

You notice that Zlip looks sad again.  “It’s a shame I lost my ship.  It was a good vessel.  Of course it was cloaked so no human could see us and it wouldn’t have shown up on any of your sensors.  I hate to say it but Emanax’s ship is bigger and faster', 'has more weapons.  Although her ship doesn’t look like a balloon if you ask me.  It looks like an upside down potty.  Anyway', 'speaking of Emanax', 'we had better get a move on.”

hint.direction: Near the balloon in the lower gardens

pages.name: BALLOON SHIPS

pages.content:
“I have never seen anything like this before!” says Zlip', 'his face full of amazement and wonder.

You think he’s talking about the squirrel you saw on the path earlier.

“No', 'this!” he says', 'pointing enthusiastically.

He means the Crazy Golf.  You tell him that most seaside places in England have at least one Crazy Golf but he’s not really listening', 'he’s straining over the fence to take a closer look.

“Hole No 8 is like the green volcano on Planet Smortar and Hole No. 13 reminds me of the Battle for the Bridge at Kanmar VII.  Oh and that pebbly bit in front of Hole No. 15 is like the time Giant Earthworms of Tembolkidook rose up from the ground after fifty years of hibernating and destroyed the city.  I mean they’re vegetarians so they spit the people out but still', 'it was a little inconvenient.  This is incredible though!”

It’s just Crazy Golf', 'you tell him.

“Your world has so many opportunities for fun and games in it.  I saw the arcades earlier', 'down by the pier.  And there are people over there kicking that round thing at each other which looks like a fun game.  Unless the round thing is a weapon and they are engaged in some kind of battle.  Are they mortal enemies?”

You tell him it’s a football.

“Sometimes life can be too serious.  Sometimes it’s just good to play and forget about everything for a while', 'don’t you think?  Look', 'there!”  He’s found the Info-Pad', 'hiding near Hole No. 5.

 

INFO-PAD: MUSCOVITE MICA

  • Phyllosilicate mineral
  • Can be transparent or translucent
  • Most common mica
  • In Elizabethan England', 'the name comes from Muscovy-glass due to its use in Medieval Russia as a cheaper form of glass

 

You ask him if he has a special fact about the gem but he’s not listening', 'he’s too busy watching the Crazy Golf.  “I wish I could play,” he says', '“but we need to get going.”

hint.direction: Near the mini golf in the lower gardens

pages.name: GOING GOLF CRAZY

pages.content:
You find the Info-Pad straight away.

INFO-PAD: MIMETITE

  • Name derives from the Greek meaning ‘imitator’
  • Lead arsenate chloride mineral
  • Chief use is as a collector’s specimen

“Look!” he says', 'pointing to the cage full of birds.  “This bird’s eye is like the mimetite', 'don’t you think?” 

He’s got a point.  The eye of the bird (which Zlip helpfully tells you is a Greater Blue-eared Starling) does look just like the gem – round and yellow and shiny. It watches your every move as you push your face against the cage – not too close though.  You’re a geologist', 'not an ornithologist.

“I wish I was a bird,” he says', '“I love flying – whether that’s in my balloon ship or whether that’s free', 'like one of these birds.  I want to be that one,” he says', 'pointing to a tiny zebra finch.  “No', 'wait! I want to be that one!”  He’s now looking at the two lovebirds that chitter chatter to each other like an old married couple.

You ask him if he has birds on his planet.  He looks sad again.  “Yes', 'but they’re huge and scary and will eat you for breakfast as soon as look at you.  They have teeth as big as my leg.”  He starts to look warily at the starling with the yellow eyes.  “I hope this fellow isn’t hungry.”

You tell him it’s probably only interested in worms or bugs.

“I wish we had birds like this,” he says. “Don’t you think birds are like dreams?  If you dream hard enough and give your dreams wings then they’ll fly – soar up into the sky – and you’ll be able to do whatever you put your mind too. It’s amazing!”

You tell him that you’ve never really thought of birds in that way before but you can see what he means.  Birds are kind of special.  And so are dreams.

“Emanax can shapeshift too,” says Zlip', 'suddenly', 'eyeing up one of the budgerigars closely.  “This one’s acting suspiciously', 'don’t you think?”

You don’t stop to find out', 'you gather the Info-Pad and leave as quickly as you can', 'hoping that the budgerigar really is a budgerigar after all and not some bloodthirsty shapeshifting alien.

hint.direction: Outside the aviary near the lower gardens

pages.name: DREAM BIRDS

pages.content:
“What happens in this building?  Is this the palace where the Queen lives?”

Not quite.  You tell Zlip all about the Pavilion and how there are lots of shows put on there – live music and theatre and dance.

This seems to excite him.  “Can you teach me to dance?”

You look at him as if to say not a chance and he must have understood because he doesn’t ask you again.

“Dance is so powerful.  The way the body moves.  It tells a story.  Not like words in a book but in a different', 'special way.  I wish I could dance.  We don’t really have dance on my planet.  Well', 'there is the Mung’Krinian Mud Dance but that’s all kinds of messy and can only be performed on the sixth day of the seventh turn of the planet at sunrise.”

You tell him that it sounds…interesting.

Zlip carries on talking.  “This is what I love about my job.  Technically', 'I’m an explorer but I like to think of myself as an interstellar collector – I visit other planets to collect memories', 'artefacts', 'histories', 'stories.  It’s the best job in the universe!  But most people on my planet don’t like the idea of exploring the galaxy.  Hence the bounty on my head.”

Every time he mentions Emanax', 'it feels as if the air gets just a little bit chillier.  You look around.  Nothing yet.  But that doesn’t mean you’re not being followed. 

Zlip sees the Info-Pad and collects it from under one of the ornamental bushes outside the Pavilion.

INFO-PAD: PURBECK MARBLE

  • Fossiliferous limestone
  • Found in the Isle of Purbeck
  • Quarried since Roman times
  • Used as decorative building stone

“I wonder if the Pavilion was built using Purbeck Marble,” says Zlip.  “You could say Geology is the study of dance too.  The way the earth moves is a kind of dance: the shifting of the tectonic plates', 'the creaking', 'crushing movement of the rocks below our feet', 'the slow turning of the world – so slow you wouldn’t even notice.  That’s the dancing story of the Earth and it’s beautiful.” 

You ask Zlip if he’s ever considered becoming a poet but he just laughs and says', '“Come on', 'let’s go!”

hint.direction: Outside the front of the pavillion

pages.name: LIFE IS DANCE AND DANCE IS LIFE

pages.content:
You try to explain to Zlip what an Oceanarium is but you don’t have much luck.

“So the fish live in boxes and people stare at them?  And then do they eat them?  Is it like Harry Ramsden’s because that’s just over the road?”  He starts pointing to the famous fish and chip shop the other side of the pier.

You try and explain again that no one eats the fish in the Oceanarium.  Except maybe the penguins', 'which are a new addition.

“We only have one type of fish,” says Zlip', '“the Mukla fish.  It’s the size of one of your pound coins but has deadly venomous tips on its scales.  They hang around in big shoals in the bay waiting for anyone foolish enough to go for a paddle.”

You look out towards the sea and remind yourself to pay closer attention the next time you want to take a dip.  Just in case.

“And that’s why I do this', 'that’s why I explore other worlds because my planet is boring and everything and everyone is the same.  We all wear the same clothes', 'eat the same food', 'have to stick by the same routine.  There’s only one fish', 'one type of bird', 'our precious stones look like pebbles. Nothing’s unique', 'nothing’s exciting.  Not like your world at all.  Look', 'there’s the Info-Pad!”

INFO-PAD: FLUORITE

  • Mineral form of calcium fluoride
  • Name derives from the Latin noun fluo meaning stream or flow of water
  • Most widely occurring mineral across the globe
  • Has many uses including chemicals', 'ornamental', 'scientific

“It’s amazing how diverse your world is,” he says.  “Did you know there are about 3800 known minerals in the world and 20,000 species of fish in the oceans?  Each one different.  And take a look around now: all the different people', 'the different accents', 'the different clothes.  You live in a colourful', 'vibrant world of difference; I hope you never forget that.  I wish I had time to discover more about it but we better get a move on.”

hint.direction: Outside the oceanarium

pages.name: DIVE INTO DIVERSITY

pages.content:
You ask Zlip to tell you more about Emanax.

“She’s a bounty hunter from my world.  Ruthless.  Vicious.  You see', 'we’re not really allowed to go off exploring other worlds.  It’s against all the rules.  Most of my people like to stay on our planet and not even think about life on other worlds.  Probably because it would freak them out.  Her task is to try and find me and bring me back to the authorities.  I’ll probably end up in prison.”  Zlip looks sad again', 'understandably.

You try and cheer him up again by pointing out the Info-Pad that’s on the beach', 'half-buried in a neglected sand fort.

INFO-PAD: GYPSUM

  • Soft sulphate mineral
  • Used as a fertiliser and form of plaster and blackboard chalk
  • Derived from the Greek for chalk or plaster
  • Moderately water soluble

You tell him that you used Plaster of Paris at school but Zlip is more interested in the sand fort than the Info-Pad.  “What epic battle has been fought here?  Are there miniature people who live in the sand and fight for the castles?  And what is this bright red thing?  Is this a magic space castle?”

You tell him it’s a bucket and that if by miniature people he means young kids then he’s kind of right.  Zlip wants to build his own sand castle but then his attention is taken by the shells in the sand.

“I love shells,” he says.  “I visited the Bournemouth Natural Sciences Society – that’s where I’ve been doing some of my exploring by the way', 'where I got all the information for my Info-Pads from – and I lost count when I got to a hundred shells!”

You ask him what else is at the museum and he says', '“All sorts!  Birds', 'animals', 'dinosaur footprints', 'shark teeth', 'an Egyptian mummy', 'ancient spearheads.  The place is amazing for an explorer and collector like me!  But that’s where Emanax first found me and she’s been after me ever since.  I can’t let her catch me!  I can’t get sent to prison!  We have to make this quantum beacon work or else…”

His voice trails off and the weight of his words is like a rain cloud in the sky on a sunny day.

hint.direction: Head to the beach', 'near the beach huts

pages.name: BEACH BATTLE

pages.content:
Ah archaeology: the study of human activity in the past through the analysis of artefacts and materials.   But you already knew that', 'didn’t you?

Weapons', 'cooking utensils', 'architecture', 'artwork - the treasure trove of human history and an archaeologist’s dream. 

Look down!  Beneath your feet might be an ancient Roman burial site waiting for discovery!  Or a prehistoric society lost in the traps of mud and time.

For now', 'let’s just stick to modern day Bournemouth', 'shall we?

Zlip seems wary', 'he keeps looking around him like he’s being watched.  You ask him if he’s OK.

“There’s something I haven’t told you,” he says', 'looking nervous.  “The reason I crashed is because I’m being hunted by an evil woman called Emanax.  She’s the one that shot down my ship and I bet she’s still out there', 'looking for me', 'hunting me.  I’ll explain more as we go but we’re going to have to be quick and we’re going to have to be careful.”

You say that you’re not afraid of some alien because you’re way too cool for that and so you ask Zlip more about what you need to do.

“If we can find the seven Info-Pads that were lost from my ship then I can combine their battery packs to my communication device and set off the quantum beacon.  They’re out there somewhere', 'we just need to find them.  Before Emanax finds us.  You know this area better than I do.  Where shall we look first?”

hint.direction: Outside Tourist Information

pages.name: THE ARCHAEOLOGIST

pages.content:
No sign of Emanax…yet.  But you can’t help shake the feeling that you’re being watched.  Luckily', 'it doesn’t take you long to find the Info-Pad perched precariously between the wooden slats of the pier.  Before Zlip pockets it', 'he lets you read it.

 

INFO-PAD: MESOLITHIC ERA

  • c9000-3500 B.C.
  • The museum boasts a variety of tools used in the Mesolithic Era
  • People were hunter-gatherers', 'living in temporary huts', 'eating game and fruit
  • Mesolithic era sites found at Hengistbury Head', 'Downton', 'and Portland

“It’s amazing,” says Zlip.  “I’ve always loved the thought of studying the past of my species but it’s outlawed.  My people are too busy looking to the present that they forget about the past.  You must think we’re pretty strange.”

You think now’s as good a time as any to talk about the elephant in the room.

Well', 'not an elephant', 'but the rabbit. 

“This is Zlartybox', 'my pet.  I found him on Planet DNKA IV.  During the battle with Emanax', 'I realised that if we had to evacuate the ship', 'Zlartybox and I would stand out a bit so I programmed these Shifter collars.”  He points to the silver collar around his neck and you see that the rabbit has one too.  “It lets us take on a different form.  I thought Zlartybox would be particularly conspicuous in Bournemouth because he’s an eight-foot', 'blue-skinned', 'nine-legged Tokai Creature with six horns on his forehead.  I thought he might be somewhat noticeable.  So I chose an everyday kind of Earth animal for him to change into.  Although people keep looking at me.  Do you not take your rabbits for walks?” 

You shake your head.  “Oh,” says Zlip.

Suddenly', 'the rabbit’s ears prick up and Zlip looks around.  You can’t hear anything but the sound of the waves and the odd seagull but Zlip is definitely spooked.  “Emanax is close.  Zlartybox can sense her.  We’d better hurry!”

hint.direction: At the front of the pier

pages.name: PIER RABBIT

pages.content:
The next Info-Pad is partially hidden underneath one of the benches near to the balloon.

INFO-PAD: BRONZE AGE

  • c2000-800 B.C.
  • The museum collection includes two burial urns
  • At about this time cremation of the dead became the norm
  • There are also replicas of tools and weapons from the Bronze Age', 'the originals of which are held at Dorchester Museum

“Unfortunately those weapons won’t be much use against Emanax,” says Zlip.  Just then you look up and the balloon nearly blocks out the whole sun', 'as if it’s a stray planet that’s come too close to Earth.  “My spaceship used to look a bit like that.” 

You tell Zlip that you’d better get a move on but he seems transfixed by the balloon.  “It’s a magical feeling', 'soaring high above planet Earth.  I’ve visited the ice caps of Antarctica and the deserts of Africa.  I’ve hovered high over the mountains of the Himalayas and down low over the mangrove forests of Pakistan.  I’ve also been to Boscombe.  Interesting place.  Have you been up in the balloon?  If you haven’t', 'and you get a chance to go', 'maybe you could imagine that you’re with me in my spaceship', 'seeing as far as the Isle of Wight on one side', 'and the Purbecks on the other.”

You notice that Zlip looks sad again.  “It’s a shame I lost my ship.  It was a good vessel.  Of course it was cloaked so no human could see us and it wouldn’t have shown up on any of your sensors.  I hate to say it but Emanax’s ship is bigger and faster', 'has more weapons.  Although her ship doesn’t look like a balloon if you ask me.  It looks like an upside down potty.  Anyway', 'speaking of Emanax', 'we had better get a move on.”

hint.direction: Near the balloon in the lower gardens

pages.name: BALLOON SHIPS

pages.content:
“I have never seen anything like this before!” says Zlip', 'his face full of amazement and wonder.

You think he’s talking about the squirrel you saw on the path earlier.

“No', 'this!” he says', 'pointing enthusiastically.

He means the Mini Golf.  You tell him that most seaside places in England have at least one Mini Golf but he’s not really listening', 'he’s straining over the fence to take a closer look.

“Hole No 8 is like the green volcano on Planet Smortor and Hole No. 13 reminds me of the Battle for the Bridge at Kanmar VII.  Oh and that pebbly bit in front of Hole No. 15 is like the time Giant Earthworms of Tembolkidook rose up from the ground after fifty years of hibernating and destroyed the city.  I mean they’re vegetarians so they spit the people out but still', 'it was a little inconvenient.  This is incredible though!”

It’s just Mini Golf', 'you tell him.

“Your world has so many opportunities for fun and games in it.  I saw the arcades earlier', 'down by the pier.  And there are people over there kicking that round thing at each other which looks like a fun game.  Unless the round thing is a weapon and they are engaged in some kind of battle.  Are they mortal enemies?”

You tell him it’s a football.

“Sometimes life can be too serious.  Sometimes it’s just good to play and forget about everything for a while', 'don’t you think?  Look', 'there!”  He’s found the Info-Pad', 'hiding near Hole No. 5.

 

INFO-PAD: ROMANO-BRITISH ERA

  • D. 42 - A.D. 410
  • The museum collection contains samples of Samian ware - found across the Roman Empire
  • There are also samples of Romano-British pottery found across local New Forest kiln sites

You ask him if he has a special fact about the pottery but he’s not listening', 'he’s too busy watching the Mini Golf.  “I wish I could play,” he says', '“but we need to get going.”

hint.direction: Near the mini golf in the lower gardens

pages.name: GOING GOING GOLF

pages.content:
You find the Info-Pad straight away.

INFO-PAD: IRON AGE

  • c800 B.C - 200 A.D
  • Evidence of local flints from Hengistbury Head and Maiden Castle
  • Improved smelting techniques enabled iron ores to yield stronger metal

“Look!” he says', 'pointing to the cage full of birds.  “That bird is the same colour as the grey flint.  I wish I was a bird.  I love flying – whether that’s in my balloon ship or whether that’s free', 'like one of these birds.  I want to be that one,” he says', 'pointing to a tiny zebra finch.  “No', 'wait! I want to be that one!”  He’s now looking at the two lovebirds that chitter chatter to each other like an old married couple.

You ask him if he has birds on his planet.  He looks sad again.  “Yes', 'but they’re huge and scary and will eat you for breakfast as soon as look at you.  They have teeth as big as my leg.”  He starts to look warily at the starling with the yellow eyes.  “I hope this fellow isn’t hungry.”

You tell him it’s probably only interested in worms or bugs.

“I wish we had birds like this,” he says. “Don’t you think birds are like dreams?  If you dream hard enough and give your dreams wings then they’ll fly – soar up into the sky – and you’ll be able to do whatever you put your mind too. It’s amazing!”

You tell him that you’ve never really thought of birds in that way before but you can see what he means.  Birds are kind of special.  And so are dreams.

“Emanax can shapeshift too,” says Zlip', 'suddenly', 'eyeing up one of the budgerigars closely.  “This one’s acting suspiciously', 'don’t you think?”

You don’t stop to find out; you gather the Info-Pad and leave as quickly as you can', 'hoping that the budgerigar really is a budgerigar after all and not some bloodthirsty shapeshifting alien.

hint.direction: Outside the aviary near the lower gardens

pages.name: DREAM BIRDS

pages.content:
“What happens in this building?  Is this the palace where the Queen lives?”

Not quite.  You tell Zlip all about the Pavilion and how there are lots of shows put on there – live music and theatre and dance.

This seems to excite him.  “Can you teach me to dance?”

You look at him as if to say not a chance and he must have understood because he doesn’t ask you again.

“Dance is so powerful.  The way the body moves.  It tells a story.  Not like words in a book but in a different', 'special way.  I wish I could dance.  We don’t really have dance on my planet.  Well', 'there is the Mung’Krinian Mud Dance but that’s all kinds of messy and can only be performed on the sixth day of the seventh turn of the planet at sunrise.”

You tell him that it sounds…interesting.

Zlip carries on talking.  “This is what I love about my job.  Technically', 'I’m an explorer but I like to think of myself as an interstellar collector – I visit other planets to collect memories', 'artefacts', 'histories', 'stories.  It’s the best job in the universe!  But most people on my planet don’t like the idea of exploring the galaxy.  Hence the bounty on my head.”

Every time he mentions Emanax', 'it feels as if the air gets just a little bit chillier.  You look around.  Nothing yet.  But that doesn’t mean you’re not being followed. 

Zlip sees the Info-Pad and collects it from under one of the ornamental bushes outside the Pavilion.

INFO-PAD: LOWER PALAEOLITHIC

  • c250,000 - 20,000 B.C.
  • Flint tools
  • Evidence of heavy stone/flint all-purpose tools
  • Found in local area

“I wonder if there’s something below the Pavilion.  If we knocked down the building and dug deep enough', 'I wonder if there’s evidence of a Lower Palaeolithic era society down there?”

You tell Zlip that you think the council might have a problem with you destroying the Pavilion.

“You’re probably right,” says Zlip.  “Let’s get going before I get any other ideas!”

hint.direction: Outside the front of the pavillion

pages.name: LIFE IS DANCE AND DANCE IS LIFE

pages.content:
You try to explain to Zlip what an Oceanarium is but you don’t have much luck.

“So the fish live in boxes and people stare at them?  And then do they eat them?  Is it like Harry Ramsden’s because that’s just over the road?”  He starts pointing to the famous fish and chip shop the other side of the pier.

You try and explain again that no one eats the fish in the Oceanarium.  Except maybe the penguins', 'which are a new addition.

“We only have one type of fish,” says Zlip', '“the Mukla fish.  It’s the size of one of your pound coins but has deadly venomous tips on its scales.  They hang around in big shoals in the bay waiting for anyone foolish enough to go for a paddle.”

You look out towards the sea and remind yourself to pay closer attention the next time you want to take a dip.  Just in case.

“And that’s why I do this', 'that’s why I explore other worlds because my planet is boring and everything and everyone is the same.  We all wear the same clothes', 'eat the same food', 'have to stick by the same routine.  There’s only one fish', 'one type of bird', 'our precious stones look like pebbles. Nothing’s unique', 'nothing’s exciting.  Not like your world at all.  Did you know there are about 20,000 species of fish in your oceans?  Each one different.  And take a look around now: all the different people', 'the different accents', 'the different clothes.  You live in a colourful', 'vibrant world of difference; I hope you never forget that.  Look', 'there’s the Info-Pad!”

INFO-PAD: MIDDLE PALAEOLITHIC

  • c250,000 - 20,000 B.C
  • Tools become more sophisticated
  • Use of flakes from a prepared discoidal core', 'called Levallois flakes

“I wish I had time to discover more about your world,” says Zlip', '“but we better get a move on.”

hint.direction: Outside the oceanarium

pages.name: DIVE INTO DIVERSITY

pages.content:
You ask Zlip to tell you more about Emanax.

“She’s a bounty hunter from my world.  Ruthless.  Vicious.  You see', 'we’re not really allowed to go off exploring other worlds.  It’s against all the rules.  Most of my people like to stay on our planet and not even think about life on other worlds.  Probably because it would freak them out.  Her task is to try and find me and bring me back to the authorities.  I’ll probably end up in prison.”  Zlip looks sad again', 'understandably.

You try and cheer him up again by pointing out the Info-Pad that’s on the beach', 'half-buried in a neglected sand fort.

INFO-PAD: NEOLITHIC ERA

  • c3500-2000 B.C
  • The museum shows evidence of the development of the axe in the Neolithic Era

“Speaking of axes and weapons,” says Zlip', '“what epic battle has been fought here?  Are there miniature people who live in the sand and fight for the castles?  And what is this bright red thing?  Is this a magic space castle?”

You tell him it’s a bucket and that if by miniature people he means young kids then he’s kind of right.  Zlip wants to build his own sand castle but then his attention is taken by the shells in the sand.

“I love shells,” he says.  “I visited the Bournemouth Natural Sciences Society – that’s where I’ve been doing some of my exploring by the way', 'where I got all the information for my Info-Pads from – and I lost count when I got to a hundred shells!”

You ask him what else is at the museum and he says', '“All sorts!  Birds', 'animals', 'dinosaur footprints', 'shark teeth', 'an Egyptian mummy', 'ancient spearheads.  The place is amazing for an explorer and collector like me!  But that’s where Emanax first found me and she’s been after me ever since.  I can’t let her catch me!  I can’t get sent to prison!  We have to make this quantum beacon work or else…”

His voice trails off and the weight of his words is like a rain cloud in the sky on a sunny day.

hint.direction: Head to the beach', 'near the beach huts

pages.name: BEACH BATTLE

pages.content:
Ah Egyptology: the study of ancient Egypt – its history', 'language', 'literature', 'religion', 'architecture', 'and art.   But you already knew that', 'didn’t you?

Pyramids', 'gods', 'mummies', 'hieroglyphs - the treasure trove of Egyptian history and an Egyptologist’s dream. 

One day I might take you to Egypt but for now', 'let’s just stick to Bournemouth', 'shall we?

Zlip seems wary', 'he keeps looking around him like he’s being watched.  You ask him if he’s OK.

“There’s something I haven’t told you,” he says', 'looking nervous.  “The reason I crashed is because I’m being hunted by an evil woman called Emanax.  She’s the one that shot down my ship and I bet she’s still out there', 'looking for me', 'hunting me.  I’ll explain more as we go but we’re going to have to be quick and we’re going to have to be careful.”

You say that you’re not afraid of some alien because you’re way too cool for that and so you ask Zlip more about what you need to do.

“If we can find the seven Info-Pads that were lost from my ship then I can combine their battery packs to my communication device and set off the quantum beacon.  They’re out there somewhere', 'we just need to find them.  Before Emanax finds us.  You know this area better than I do.  Where shall we look first?”

hint.direction: Outside Tourist Information

pages.name: THE EGYPTOLOGIST

pages.content:
No sign of Emanax…yet.  But you can’t help shake the feeling that you’re being watched.  Luckily', 'it doesn’t take you long to find the Info-Pad perched precariously between the wooden slats of the pier.  Before Zlip pockets it', 'he lets you read it.

 

INFO-PAD: KING AMENEMHAT III

  • Black basalt replica of the King’s head
  • From the XIIth Dynasty
  • c2400 B.C.

“It’s amazing,” says Zlip.  “Beautifully carved', 'don’t you think?  We don’t have anything on our world like this', 'nothing even comes close.  My people don’t believe in craft or art or statues like this.  You must think my planet’s pretty strange.” 

You think now’s as good a time as any to talk about the elephant in the room.

Well', 'not an elephant', 'but the rabbit. 

“This is Zlartybox', 'my pet.  I found him on Planet DNKA IV.  During the battle with Emanax', 'I realised that if we had to evacuate the ship', 'Zlartybox and I would stand out a bit so I programmed these Shifter collars.”  He points to the silver collar around his neck and you see that the rabbit has one too.  “It lets us take on a different form.  I thought Zlartybox would be particularly conspicuous in Bournemouth because he’s an eight-foot', 'blue-skinned', 'nine-legged Tokai Creature with six horns on his forehead.  I thought he might be somewhat noticeable.  So I chose an everyday kind of Earth animal for him to change into.  Although people keep looking at me.  Do you not take your rabbits for walks?” 

You shake your head.  “Oh,” says Zlip.

Suddenly', 'the rabbit’s ears prick up and Zlip looks around.  You can’t hear anything but the sound of the waves and the odd seagull but Zlip is definitely spooked.  “Emanax is close.  Zlartybox can sense her.  We’d better hurry!”

hint.direction: At the front of the pier

pages.name: PIER RABBIT

You find the Info-Pad partially hidden under one of the benches near to the balloon', 'which cheers Zlip up after all this talk of Emanax.

 

INFO-PAD: LIMESTONE RELIEFS

  • Believed to come from Asasif region of the Western Valley opposite Thebes
  • From Queen Hatshepsut’s mortuary temple
  • The relief in the museum shows King Thutmose III and Queen Hatshepsut

After you read the Info-Pad', 'Zlip pockets it and you continue on your quest.

hint.direction: Near the balloon in the lower gardens

  • Made by Giovanni Belzoni', 'an excavator in Egypt
  • 1820
  • In the museum are three pictures recording the discovery of the tombs of King Seti I in the Valley of the Kings

“This is Zlartybox', 'my pet.  I found him on Planet DNKA IV.  During the battle with Emanax', 'I realised that if we had to evacuate the ship', 'Zlartybox and I would stand out a bit so I programmed these Shifter collars.”  He points to the silver collar around his neck and you see that the rabbit has one too.  “It lets us take on a different form.  I thought Zlartybox would be particularly conspicuous in Bournemouth because he’s an eight-foot', 'blue-skinned', 'nine-legged Tokai Creature with six horns on his forehead.  I thought he might be somewhat noticeable.  So I chose an everyday kind of Earth animal for him to change into.  Although people keep looking at me.  Do you not take your rabbits for walks?” 

You shake your head.  “Oh,” says Zlip.

Suddenly', 'the rabbit’s ears prick up and Zlip looks around.  You can’t hear anything but the sound of the waves and the odd seagull but Zlip is definitely spooked.  “Emanax is close.  Zlartybox can sense her.  We’d better hurry!”

hint.direction: At the front of the pier

pages.name: PIER RABBIT

pages.content:
The next Info-Pad is partially hidden underneath one of the benches near to the balloon.

INFO-PAD: CYPRAEA LYNX

  • Common name: Lynx cowry
  • Species of small sea snail
  • Average 38-50mm in length
  • Cowries live in tropical shallow water', 'usually under rocks or in corals

As you look up', 'the balloon nearly blocks out the whole sun as if it’s a stray planet that’s come too close to Earth.  “My spaceship used to look a bit like that,” says Zlip. “And it was the same mottled brown and white colour as the Cypraea Lynx shell.”

You tell Zlip that you’d better get a move on but he seems transfixed by the balloon.  “It’s a magical feeling', 'soaring high above planet Earth.  I’ve visited the ice caps of Antarctica and the deserts of Africa.  I’ve hovered high over the mountains of the Himalayas and down low over the mangrove forests of Pakistan.  I’ve also been to Boscombe.  Interesting place.  Have you been up in the balloon?  If you haven’t', 'and you get a chance to go', 'maybe you could imagine that you’re with me in my spaceship', 'seeing as far as the Isle of Wight on one side', 'and the Purbecks on the other.”

You notice that Zlip looks sad again.  “It’s a shame I lost my ship.  It was a good vessel.  Of course it was cloaked so no human could see us and it wouldn’t have shown up on any of your sensors.  I hate to say it but Emanax’s ship is bigger and faster', 'has more weapons.  Although her ship doesn’t look like a balloon if you ask me.  It looks like an upside down potty.  Anyway', 'speaking of Emanax', 'we had better get a move on.”

hint.direction: Near the balloon in the lower gardens

pages.name: BALLOON SHIPS

pages.content:
“I have never seen anything like this before!” says Zlip', 'his face full of amazement and wonder.

You think he’s talking about the squirrel you saw on the path earlier.

“No', 'this!” he says', 'pointing enthusiastically.

He means the Mini Golf.  You tell him that most seaside places in England have at least one Mini Golf but he’s not really listening', 'he’s straining over the fence to take a closer look.

“Hole No 8 is like the green volcano on Planet Smortor and Hole No. 13 reminds me of the Battle for the Bridge at Kanmar VII.  Oh and that pebbly bit in front of Hole No. 15 is like the time Giant Earthworms of Tembolkidook rose up from the ground after fifty years of hibernating and destroyed the city.  I mean they’re vegetarians so they spit the people out but still', 'it was a little inconvenient.  This is incredible though!”

It’s just Mini Golf', 'you tell him.

“Your world has so many opportunities for fun and games in it.  I saw the arcades earlier', 'down by the pier.  And there are people over there kicking that round thing at each other which looks like a fun game.  Unless the round thing is a weapon and they are engaged in some kind of battle.  Are they mortal enemies?”

You tell him it’s a football.

“Sometimes life can be too serious.  Sometimes it’s just good to play and forget about everything for a while', 'don’t you think?  Look', 'there!”  He’s found the Info-Pad', 'hiding near Hole No. 5.

 

INFO-PAD: PATELLA LONGICOSTA

  • Also called duck’s-foot limpet
  • Native to coasts of South Africa
  • Grows to a diameter of about 70mm
  • Cultivates a species of brown algae

You ask him if he has a special fact about this shell but he’s not listening', 'he’s too busy watching the Mini Golf.  “I wish I could play,” he says', '“but we need to get going.”

hint.direction: Near the mini golf in the lower gardens

pages.name: GOING GOING GOLF

pages.content:
You find the Info-Pad straight away.

INFO-PAD: STROMBUS GALLUS

  • Common name: rooster conch
  • Medium-sized sea snail
  • Average length: 12.5 cm
  • Found from Florida to Brazil

“Look!” he says', 'pointing to the cage full of birds.  “This bird’s eye is the same colour as the Strombus Gallus', 'don’t you think?” 

He’s got a point.  The eye of the bird has the same kind of orangey colour.  It watches your every move as you push your face against the cage – not too close though. 

“I wish I was a bird,” he says', '“I love flying – whether that’s in my balloon ship or whether that’s free', 'like one of these birds.  I want to be that one,” he says', 'pointing to a tiny zebra finch.  “No', 'wait! I want to be that one!”  He’s now looking at the two lovebirds that chitter chatter to each other like an old married couple.

You ask him if he has birds on his planet.  He looks sad again.  “Yes', 'but they’re huge and scary and will eat you for breakfast as soon as look at you.  They have teeth as big as my leg.”  He starts to look warily at the starling with the yellow eyes.  “I hope this fellow isn’t hungry.”

You tell him it’s probably only interested in worms or bugs.

“I wish we had birds like this,” he says. “Don’t you think birds are like dreams?  If you dream hard enough and give your dreams wings then they’ll fly – soar up into the sky – and you’ll be able to do whatever you put your mind too. It’s amazing!”

You tell him that you’ve never really thought of birds in that way before but you can see what he means.  Birds are kind of special.  And so are dreams.

“Emanax can shape-shift too,” says Zlip', 'suddenly', 'eyeing up one of the budgerigars closely.  “This one’s acting suspiciously', 'don’t you think?”

You don’t stop to find out', 'you gather the Info-Pad and leave as quickly as you can', 'hoping that the budgerigar really is a budgerigar after all and not some bloodthirsty shape-shifting alien.

hint.direction: Outside the aviary near the lower gardens

pages.name: DREAM BIRDS

pages.content:
“What happens in this building?  Is this the palace where the Queen lives?”

Not quite.  You tell Zlip all about the Pavilion and how there are lots of shows put on there – live music and theatre and dance.

This seems to excite him.  “Can you teach me to dance?”

You look at him as if to say not a chance and he must have understood because he doesn’t ask you again.

“Dance is so powerful.  The way the body moves.  It tells a story.  Not like words in a book but in a different', 'special way.  I wish I could dance.  We don’t really have dance on my planet.  Well', 'there is the Mung’Krinian Mud Dance but that’s all kinds of messy and can only be performed on the sixth day of the seventh turn of the planet at sunrise.”

You tell him that it sounds…interesting.

Zlip carries on talking.  “This is what I love about my job.  Technically', 'I’m an explorer but I like to think of myself as an interstellar collector – I visit other planets to collect memories', 'artefacts', 'histories', 'stories.  It’s the best job in the universe!  But most people on my planet don’t like the idea of exploring the galaxy.  Hence the bounty on my head.”

Every time he mentions Emanax', 'it feels as if the air gets just a little bit chillier.  You look around.  Nothing yet.  But that doesn’t mean you’re not being followed. 

Zlip sees the Info-Pad and collects it from under one of the ornamental bushes outside the Pavilion.

INFO-PAD: MUREX

  • Genus of medium to large-sized predatory tropical sea snail
  • The word ‘murex’ was used by Aristotle', 'making it one of the oldest classical seashell names still in use
  • Region: Indo-Pacific coastal areas

“Speaking of predators,” says Zlip', '“we should probably get out of here in case Emanax is close.”

hint.direction: Outside the front of the pavillion

pages.name: LIFE IS DANCE AND DANCE IS LIFE

pages.content:
You try to explain to Zlip what an Oceanarium is but you don’t have much luck.

“So the fish live in boxes and people stare at them?  And then do they eat them?  Is it like Harry Ramsden’s because that’s just over the road?”  He starts pointing to the famous fish and chip shop the other side of the pier.

You try and explain again that no one eats the fish in the Oceanarium.  Except maybe the penguins', 'which are a new addition.

“We only have one type of fish,” says Zlip', '“the Mukla fish.  It’s the size of one of your pound coins but has deadly venomous tips on its scales.  They hang around in big shoals in the bay waiting for anyone foolish enough to go for a paddle.”

You look out towards the sea and remind yourself to pay closer attention the next time you want to take a dip.  Just in case.

“And that’s why I do this', 'that’s why I explore other worlds because my planet is boring and everything and everyone is the same.  We all wear the same clothes', 'eat the same food', 'have to stick by the same routine.  There’s only one fish', 'one type of bird', 'our precious stones look like pebbles. Nothing’s unique', 'nothing’s exciting.  Not like your world at all.  Look', 'there’s the Info-Pad!”

INFO-PAD: TURBO MARMORATUS

  • Also known as the green turban
  • Large species of marine gastropod
  • Commercially fished as a source of mother of pearl
  • Region: Tropical reefs in Indian and Pacific oceans

“It’s amazing how diverse your world is,” he says.  “Did you know there are about 40,000 species of snail in the world and 20,000 species of fish in the oceans?  Each one different.  And take a look around now: all the different people', 'the different accents', 'the different clothes.  You live in a colourful', 'vibrant world of difference; I hope you never forget that.  I wish I had time to discover more about it but we better get a move on.”

hint.direction: Outside the oceanarium

pages.name: DIVE INTO DIVERSITY

pages.content:
You ask Zlip to tell you more about Emanax.

“She’s a bounty hunter from my world.  Ruthless.  Vicious.  You see', 'we’re not really allowed to go off exploring other worlds.  It’s against all the rules.  Most of my people like to stay on our planet and not even think about life on other worlds.  Probably because it would freak them out.  Her task is to try and find me and bring me back to the authorities.  I’ll probably end up in prison.”  Zlip looks sad again', 'understandably.

You try and cheer him up again by pointing out the Info-Pad that’s on the beach', 'half-buried in a neglected sand fort.

INFO-PAD: MITRA MITRA

  • Common name: Episcopal miter
  • Species of large predatory sea snail
  • Known to be carnivorous', 'feeds on smaller gastropods and bivalves
  • Max length is 18cm

Zlip shudders.  “Emanax is a predator', 'just like the Mitra Mitra although she’s a lot scarier!  But wait!  What epic battle has been fought here?  Are there miniature people who live in the sand and fight for the castles?  And what is this bright red thing?  Is this a magic space castle?”

You tell him it’s a bucket and that if by miniature people he means young kids then he’s kind of right.  Zlip wants to build his own sand castle but then his attention is taken by the shells in the sand.

“The Mitra Mitra is one of my favourite shells,” he says.  “I visited the Bournemouth Natural Sciences Society – that’s where I’ve been doing some of my exploring by the way', 'where I got all the information for my Info-Pads from – and I lost count when I got to a hundred shells!”

You ask him what else is at the museum and he says', '“All sorts!  Birds', 'animals', 'dinosaur footprints', 'shark teeth', 'an Egyptian mummy', 'ancient spearheads.  The place is amazing for an explorer and collector like me!  But that’s where Emanax first found me and she’s been after me ever since.  I can’t let her catch me!  I can’t get sent to prison!  We have to make this quantum beacon work or else…”

His voice trails off and the weight of his words is like a rain cloud in the sky on a sunny day.

hint.direction: Head to the beach', 'near the beach huts

pages.name: BEACH BATTLE

pages.content:
Ah ornithology: the study of birds.    But you already knew that', 'didn’t you?

Teals', 'turns', 'thrushes', 'toucans - the natural feathered treasure trove of our wonderful planet and an ornithologist’s dream. 

One day I might take you up above the skies of the Andean mountains to see the majestic Condor in flight but for now', 'let’s just stick to Bournemouth', 'shall we?

Zlip seems wary', 'he keeps looking around him like he’s being watched.  You ask him if he’s OK.

“There’s something I haven’t told you,” he says', 'looking nervous.  “The reason I crashed is because I’m being hunted by an evil woman called Emanax.  She’s the one that shot down my ship and I bet she’s still out there', 'looking for me', 'hunting me.  I’ll explain more as we go but we’re going to have to be quick and we’re going to have to be careful.”

You say that you’re not afraid of some alien because you’re way too cool for that and so you ask Zlip more about what you need to do.

“If we can find the seven Info-Pads that were lost from my ship then I can combine their battery packs to my communication device and set off the quantum beacon.  They’re out there somewhere', 'we just need to find them.  Before Emanax finds us.  You know this area better than I do.  Where shall we look first?”

hint.direction: Outside Tourist Information

pages.name: THE ORNITHOLOGIST

pages.content:
No sign of Emanax…yet.  But you can’t help shake the feeling that you’re being watched.  Luckily', 'it doesn’t take you long to find the Info-Pad perched precariously between the wooden slats of the pier.  Before Zlip pockets it', 'he lets you read it.

 

INFO-PAD: FLAMINGO

  • There are six known species
  • Name comes from Portuguese/Spanish flamengo', 'meaning ‘flame-coloured’
  • Distribution: North and South America', 'Africa', 'Europe', 'Asia
  • Feed on brine shrimp and blue-green algae

“It’s amazing,” says Zlip.  “Don’t you think it’s beautiful?  Such an incredible colour!  We don’t have anything on our world like this', 'nothing even comes close.  We only have one species of bird and that’s all grey and boring.  You must think my planet’s pretty strange.” 

You say it had crossed your mind and you think now’s as good a time as any to talk about the elephant in the room.

Well', 'not an elephant', 'but the rabbit. 

“This is Zlartybox', 'my pet.  I found him on Planet DNKA IV.  During the battle with Emanax', 'I realised that if we had to evacuate the ship', 'Zlartybox and I would stand out a bit so I programmed these Shifter collars.”  He points to the silver collar around his neck and you see that the rabbit has one too.  “It lets us take on a different form.  I thought Zlartybox would be particularly conspicuous in Bournemouth because he’s an eight-foot', 'blue-skinned', 'nine-legged Tokai Creature with six horns on his forehead.  I thought he might be somewhat noticeable.  So I chose an everyday kind of Earth animal for him to change into.  Although people keep looking at me.  Do you not take your rabbits for walks?” 

You shake your head.  “Oh,” says Zlip.

pages.name: PIER RABBIT

pages.content:
The next Info-Pad is partially hidden underneath one of the benches near to the balloon.

  • Member of the falcon genus', 'Falco
  • Can hover at a height of 10-20 metres off the ground
  • Common kestrels are sensitive to UV which allows them to locate trails of voles
  • Sometimes called a ‘windhover’

As you look up', 'the balloon nearly blocks out the whole sun as if it’s a stray planet that’s come too close to Earth.  “My spaceship used to look a bit like that,” says Zlip.  “Only it wasn’t powered by gas and air.  It was powered by grgyoxxineutrino particle emissions which comes from a precious stone on the planet Govanor.  It can travel between galaxies really quickly or it can hover low above a planet’s surface', 'just like the kestrel.”

INFO-PAD: BRAMBLING

  • Member of the finch family', 'Fringillidae
  • Name derived from West German brămas', 'meaning bramble or thorny bush
  • Distribution: Europe', 'Asia

 

You ask him if he has a special fact about the brambling but he’s not listening', 'he’s too busy watching the Mini Golf.  “I wish I could play,” he says', '“but we need to get going.”

hint.direction: Near the mini golf in the lower gardens

pages.name: GOING GOING GOLF

pages.content:
You find the Info-Pad straight away.

INFO-PAD: GOLDEN EAGLE

  • Maintains home range territories as large as 200 square kilometres
  • Distribution: Europe', 'Asia', 'North America', 'North Africa
  • Has been known to hunt prey as large as wolves

  • Distribution: Europe', 'Asia', 'Africa
  • Seen around lakes', 'rivers', 'ponds', 'marshes', 'near the sea coast
  • Feeds on aquatic creatures
  • Up to a metre tall

You ask Zlip if he’s ever considered becoming a poet but he just laughs and says', '“Come on', 'let’s go!”

  • Second most widely distributed raptor species

  • Distribution: North America
  • Could reach speeds of up to 62mph
  • Last wild bird shot in 1900
  • Last bird in captivity died in 1914

pages.name: BEACH BATTLE

pages.content:
Ah history: the study of the past and everything that’s come before.  But you already knew that', 'didn’t you?

One day I might take you to London in the Victorian era and hope we don’t bump into Jack the Ripper but for now', 'let’s just stick to Bournemouth', 'shall we?  This particular historical trip down memory lane will tell you all about the past presidents of Bournemouth Natural Sciences Society but you’ll hear more about that as you make help Zlip with his task.

Speaking of which…

Zlip seems wary', 'he keeps looking around him like he’s being watched.  You ask him if he’s OK.

“There’s something I haven’t told you,” he says', 'looking nervous.  “The reason I crashed is because I’m being hunted by an evil woman called Emanax.  She’s the one that shot down my ship and I bet she’s still out there', 'looking for me', 'hunting me.  I’ll explain more as we go but we’re going to have to be quick and we’re going to have to be careful.”

You say that you’re not afraid of some alien because you’re way too cool for that and so you ask Zlip more about what you need to do.

“If we can find the seven Info-Pads that were lost from my ship then I can combine their battery packs to my communication device and set off the quantum beacon.  They’re out there somewhere', 'we just need to find them.  Before Emanax finds us.  You know this area better than I do.  Where shall we look first?”

hint.direction: Outside Tourist Information

pages.name: THE HISTORIAN

pages.content:
No sign of Emanax…yet.  But you can’t help shake the feeling that you’re being watched.  Luckily', 'it doesn’t take you long to find the Info-Pad perched precariously between the wooden slats of the pier.  Before Zlip pockets it', 'he lets you read it.

 

INFO-PAD: John Elmes Beales

  • Founder of Beales Department Store
  • One of the first presidents of the Bournemouth Natural Science Society
  • President from: 1903-1904

“What’s a department store?” asks Zlip.

You describe to him what it is and you say that Beales is actually just round the corner and you could take him to visit but Zlip reminds you how little time you have. 

“It’s amazing,” says Zlip.  “We don’t have anything on our world like department stores.  You must think my planet’s pretty strange.” 

You think now’s as good a time as any to talk about the elephant in the room.

Well', 'not an elephant', 'but the rabbit.                     

“This is Zlartybox', 'my pet.  I found him on Planet DNKA IV.  During the battle with Emanax', 'I realised that if we had to evacuate the ship', 'Zlartybox and I would stand out a bit so I programmed these Shifter collars.”  He points to the silver collar around his neck and you see that the rabbit has one too.  “It lets us take on a different form.  I thought Zlartybox would be particularly conspicuous in Bournemouth because he’s an eight-foot', 'blue-skinned', 'nine-legged Tokai Creature with six horns on his forehead.  I thought he might be somewhat noticeable.  So I chose an everyday kind of Earth animal for him to change into.  Although people keep looking at me.  Do you not take your rabbits for walks?” 

You shake your head.  “Oh,” says Zlip.

Suddenly', 'the rabbit’s ears prick up and Zlip looks around.  You can’t hear anything but the sound of the waves and the odd seagull but Zlip is definitely spooked.  “Emanax is close.  Zlartybox can sense her.  We’d better hurry!”

hint.direction: At the front of the pier

pages.name: PIER RABBIT

pages.content:
The next Info-Pad is partially hidden underneath one of the benches near to the balloon.

INFO-PAD: MARGARET BROOKS

  • Published two major books on butterflies and moths
  • President from: 1980-1981

“I love butterflies,” says Zlip.  “There are so many at the society museum.”

As you look up', 'the balloon nearly blocks out the whole sun as if it’s a stray planet that’s come too close to Earth.  “My spaceship used to look a bit like that,” says Zlip. “The hull is the same colour red as a Peacock butterfly.  And my ship wasn’t powered by gas and air.  It was powered by grgyoxxineutrino particle emissions which comes from a stone on the planet Govanor.” 

You tell Zlip that you’d better get a move on but he seems transfixed by the balloon.  “It’s a magical feeling', 'soaring high above planet Earth.  I’ve visited the ice caps of Antarctica and the deserts of Africa.  I’ve hovered high over the mountains of the Himalayas and down low over the mangrove forests of Pakistan.  I’ve also been to Boscombe.  Interesting place.  Have you been up in the balloon?  If you haven’t', 'and you get a chance to go', 'maybe you could imagine that you’re with me in my spaceship', 'seeing as far as the Isle of Wight on one side', 'and the Purbecks on the other.”

You notice that Zlip looks sad again.  “It’s a shame I lost my ship.  It was a good vessel.  Of course it was cloaked so no human could see us and it wouldn’t have shown up on any of your sensors.  I hate to say it but Emanax’s ship is bigger and faster', 'has more weapons.  Although her ship doesn’t look like a balloon if you ask me.  It looks like an upside down potty.  Anyway', 'speaking of Emanax', 'we had better get a move on.”

hint.direction: Near the balloon in the lower gardens

pages.name: BALLOON SHIPS

pages.content:
“I have never seen anything like this before!” says Zlip', 'his face full of amazement and wonder.

You think he’s talking about the squirrel you saw on the path earlier.

“No', 'this!” he says', 'pointing enthusiastically.

He means the Mini Golf.  You tell him that most seaside places in England have at least one Mini Golf but he’s not really listening', 'he’s straining over the fence to take a closer look.

“Hole No 8 is like the green volcano on Planet Smortor and Hole No. 13 reminds me of the Battle for the Bridge at Kanmar VII.  Oh and that pebbly bit in front of Hole No. 15 is like the time Giant Earthworms of Tembolkidook rose up from the ground after fifty years of hibernating and destroyed the city.  I mean they’re vegetarians so they spit the people out but still', 'it was a little inconvenient.  This is incredible though!”

It’s just Mini Golf', 'you tell him.

“Your world has so many opportunities for fun and games in it.  I saw the arcades earlier', 'down by the pier.  And there are people over there kicking that round thing at each other which looks like a fun game.  Unless the round thing is a weapon and they are engaged in some kind of battle.  Are they mortal enemies?”

You tell him it’s a football.

“Sometimes life can be too serious.  Sometimes it’s just good to play and forget about everything for a while', 'don’t you think?  Look', 'there!”  He’s found the Info-Pad', 'hiding near Hole No. 5.

 

INFO-PAD: HEYWOOD SUMNER

  • Strong passion for archaeology
  • Excavated sites in New Forest
  • President from: 1926-1928

You ask him if he has a special fact about Heywood Sumner but he’s not listening', 'he’s too busy watching the Mini Golf so you realise you’ll have to visit the museum to find out more.  “I wish I could play golf,” he says', '“but we need to get going.”

hint.direction: Near the mini golf in the lower gardens

pages.name: GOING GOING GOLF

pages.content:
You find the Info-Pad straight away.

INFO-PAD: JAMES FISHER

  • Author', 'broadcaster', 'naturalist', 'ornithologist.
  • Made over 1000 radio and TV broadcasts on natural history
  • President from: 1960-1961

“What’s an ornithologist?” asks Zlip.

You tell him it’s someone who studies birds.

“I wish I was a bird,” he says', '“I love flying – whether that’s in my balloon ship or whether that’s free', 'like one of these birds.  I want to be that one,” he says', 'pointing to a tiny zebra finch.  “No', 'wait! I want to be that one!”  He’s now looking at the two lovebirds that chitter chatter to each other like an old married couple.

You ask him if he has birds on his planet.  He looks sad again.  “Yes', 'but they’re huge and scary and will eat you for breakfast as soon as look at you.  They have teeth as big as my leg.”  He starts to look warily at the starling with the yellow eyes.  “I hope this fellow isn’t hungry.”

You tell him it’s probably only interested in worms or bugs.

“I wish we had birds like this,” he says. “Don’t you think birds are like dreams?  If you dream hard enough and give your dreams wings then they’ll fly – soar up into the sky – and you’ll be able to do whatever you put your mind too. It’s amazing!”

You tell him that you’ve never really thought of birds in that way before but you can see what he means.  Birds are kind of special.  And so are dreams.

“Emanax can shape-shift too,” says Zlip', 'suddenly', 'eyeing up one of the budgerigars closely.  “This one’s acting suspiciously', 'don’t you think?”

You don’t stop to find out', 'you gather the Info-Pad and leave as quickly as you can', 'hoping that the budgerigar really is a budgerigar after all and not some bloodthirsty shape-shifting alien.

hint.direction: Outside the aviary near the lower gardens

pages.name: DREAM BIRDS

pages.content:
“What happens in this building?  Is this the palace where the Queen lives?”

Not quite.  You tell Zlip all about the Pavilion and how there are lots of shows put on there – live music and theatre and dance.

This seems to excite him.  “Can you teach me to dance?”

You look at him as if to say not a chance and he must have understood because he doesn’t ask you again.

“Dance is so powerful.  The way the body moves.  It tells a story.  Not like words in a book but in a different', 'special way.  I wish I could dance.  We don’t really have dance on my planet.  Well', 'there is the Mung’Krinian Mud Dance but that’s all kinds of messy and can only be performed on the sixth day of the seventh turn of the planet at sunrise.”

You tell him that it sounds…interesting.

Zlip carries on talking.  “This is what I love about my job.  Technically', 'I’m an explorer but I like to think of myself as an interstellar collector – I visit other planets to collect memories', 'artefacts', 'histories', 'stories.  It’s the best job in the universe!  But most people on my planet don’t like the idea of exploring the galaxy.  Hence the bounty on my head.”

Every time he mentions Emanax', 'it feels as if the air gets just a little bit chillier.  You look around.  Nothing yet.  But that doesn’t mean you’re not being followed. 

Zlip sees the Info-Pad and collects it from under one of the ornamental bushes outside the Pavilion.

INFO-PAD: DAME KATHLEEN LONSDALE

  • One of the first women to be elected to fellowship of the society
  • Had a major influence on the development of X-ray crystallography
  • President from: 1964-1965

“You could say History is a kind of dance too.  The earth shifting and changing to the rhythmic slow-ticking of time', 'the backwards and forwards hand in hand shuffle of the past and the present.  That’s the dancing story of history and it’s beautiful.” 

You ask Zlip if he’s ever considered becoming a poet but he just laughs and says', '“Come on', 'let’s go!”

hint.direction: Outside the front of the pavillion

pages.name: LIFE IS DANCE AND DANCE IS LIFE

pages.content:
You try to explain to Zlip what an Oceanarium is but you don’t have much luck.

“So the fish live in boxes and people stare at them?  And then do they eat them?  Is it like Harry Ramsden’s because that’s just over the road?”  He starts pointing to the famous fish and chip shop the other side of the pier.

You try and explain again that no one eats the fish in the Oceanarium.  Except maybe the penguins', 'which are a new addition.

“We only have one type of fish,” says Zlip', '“the Mukla fish.  It’s the size of one of your pound coins but has deadly venomous tips on its scales.  They hang around in big shoals in the bay waiting for anyone foolish enough to go for a paddle.”

You look out towards the sea and remind yourself to pay closer attention the next time you want to take a dip.  Just in case.

“And that’s why I do this', 'that’s why I explore other worlds because my planet is boring and everything and everyone is the same.  We all wear the same clothes', 'eat the same food', 'have to stick by the same routine.  There’s only one fish', 'one type of bird', 'our precious stones look like pebbles. Nothing’s unique', 'nothing’s exciting.  Not like your world at all.  Look', 'there’s the Info-Pad!”

INFO-PAD: ALFRED RUSSEL WALLACE

  • First honorary member
  • Naturalist', 'explorer', 'geographer', 'anthropologist and biologist
  • Independently proposed theory of natural selection which prompted Charles Darwin to publish his own theory

“Evolution has meant that your world is so incredibly diverse,” says Zlip.  “Did you know there are about 20,000 species of fish in the oceans?  Each one different.  And take a look around now: all the different people', 'the different accents', 'the different clothes.  You live in a colourful', 'vibrant world of difference; I hope you never forget that.  I wish I had time to discover more about it but we better get a move on.”

hint.direction: Outside the oceanarium

pages.name: DIVE INTO DIVERSITY

pages.content:
You ask Zlip to tell you more about Emanax.

“She’s a bounty hunter from my world.  Ruthless.  Vicious.  You see', 'we’re not really allowed to go off exploring other worlds.  It’s against all the rules.  Most of my people like to stay on our planet and not even think about life on other worlds.  Probably because it would freak them out.  Her task is to try and find me and bring me back to the authorities.  I’ll probably end up in prison.”  Zlip looks sad again', 'understandably.

You try and cheer him up again by pointing out the Info-Pad that’s on the beach', 'half-buried in a neglected sand fort.

INFO-PAD: FIELD MARSHALL LORD GRENFELL

  • Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Army in late 19th Century
  • Responsible for a large part of the Egyptology collection at the museum
  • Took part in excavations at Aswan in the 1880s

“Ah', 'a man who is used to battles', 'just like myself,” says Zlip', 'puffing out his chest.  “But wait!  What epic battle has been fought here?”  He’s looking at the sand forts.  “Are there miniature people who live in the sand and fight for the castles?  And what is this bright red thing?  Is this a magic space castle?”

You tell him it’s a bucket and that if by miniature people he means young kids then he’s kind of right.  Zlip wants to build his own sand castle but then his attention is taken by the shells in the sand.

“I love shells,” he says.  “I visited the Bournemouth Natural Sciences Society – that’s where I’ve been doing some of my exploring by the way', 'where I got all the information for my Info-Pads from – and I lost count when I got to a hundred shells!”

You ask him what else is at the museum and he says', '“All sorts!  Birds', 'animals', 'dinosaur footprints', 'shark teeth', 'an Egyptian mummy that would interest Lord Grenfell', 'ancient spearheads.  The place is amazing for an explorer and collector like me!  But that’s where Emanax first found me and she’s been after me ever since.  I can’t let her catch me!  I can’t get sent to prison!  We have to make this quantum beacon work or else…”

His voice trails off and the weight of his words is like a rain cloud in the sky on a sunny day.

hint.direction: Head to the beach', 'near the beach huts

pages.name: BEACH BATTLE

Fossils', 'Tyrannosaurus Rex', 'Archaeopteryx – prehistory’s rich treasure trove and a palaeontologist’s dream. 

One day I might take you to the swamps of the Jurassic era but for now', 'let’s just stick to modern-day Bournemouth', 'shall we?

  • From 10,000 years ago

pages.name: GOING GOING GOLF

  • Found: Isle of Portland
