You tell him it’s a bucket and that if by miniature people he means young kids then he’s kind of right.  Zlip wants to build his own sand castle but then his attention is taken by the shells in the sand.

“I love shells,” he says.  “I visited the Bournemouth Natural Sciences Society – that’s where I’ve been doing some of my exploring by the way', 'where I got all the information for my Info-Pads from – and I lost count when I got to a hundred shells!”

You ask him what else is at the museum and he says', '“All sorts!  Birds', 'animals', 'dinosaur footprints', 'the shark teeth', 'an Egyptian mummy', 'ancient spearheads.  The place is amazing for an explorer and collector like me!  But that’s where Emanax first found me and she’s been after me ever since.  I can’t let her catch me!  I can’t get sent to prison!  We have to make this quantum beacon work or else…”

His voice trails off and the weight of his words is like a rain cloud in the sky on a sunny day.

hint.direction: Head to the beach', 'near the beach huts

pages.name: BEACH BATTLE

pages.content:
Zlip’s face is racked with panic.  “We don’t have enough of the Info-Pads to send a signal to the mothership!”

You ask Zlip what we can do but he just looks at you with those same sad eyes that he had when you first met him which seems so long ago now.  “There’s nothing we can do,” he says', 'shaking his head. 

But now you watch as his face collapses from one of sadness to one of utter terror as he holds up a shaking hand and points to something behind you.

You don’t even need to turn around to know it’s Emanax.  You can feel her cold breath on the back of your neck', 'smell the hideous odour emanating from her – a wicked stench of rotten eggs and gone off Pickled Onion flavour crisps and dirty nappies.  Nice.

“Run!” shouts Zlip but it’s too late.  Emanax leaps right on up and over you', 'landing with a thud in front of Zlip', 'blocking his path.  With one foul swoop', 'she lifts Zlip and the rabbit up into her scaly arms.

“Finally!” she cries', 'and her voice is a blood-curdling', 'nails-down-chalkboards kind of a screech.  “You thought you could run from me but you were mistaken.  I’m going to look forward to handing you over to the authorities.  They promised me a handsome reward for your capture.”

Zlip is still struggling valiantly', 'trying to slip out of her grasp', 'and you have to hand it to the little guy – he’s not going to go down without a fight.  You take a brave step forward', 'to help your new friend', 'but Emanax locks her cold gaze on you and you freeze.  “I wouldn’t move another inch', 'if I were you.”  And then you notice in her other hand she has a gun-like weapon trained directly at you. 

Zlip tries another tactic.  “You’re a fool if you think they’re going to give you any reward.  I know my people.  They’ll kill you as soon as you hand me over.  The only thing you’ll get is a quick', 'cold death.”

This riles Emanax even more.  “Fool!  You think you can trick me into letting you go!  That’s not going to happen.  I’m going to watch you rot in jail.”

And then Zlip turns to you.  “You haven’t seen the last of me,” he says', '“I’ll find a way out of this.  I’ll come back to Earth one day', 'I promise.  They can’t lock me up forever.”

Emanax grunts.  “We’ll see about that!”  Then she says something in a language that you’ve never heard before – a series of guttural clicks – and one second Zlip is there and the next he is disappearing into a shimmering golden haze.  You cry out but there’s nothing you can do.

He’s gone.

Emanax keeps her weapon trained on you.  “I’m sparing your life because you are not my bounty.  But be warned.  The next time I encounter your people', 'I might not be so forgiving.”  Another command', 'more shimmering golden haze', 'and she’s gone leaving you alone on the pier.

You look up into the sky and it might just be the glint of an aircraft or it might be the engine flash of Emanax’s spaceship.  Whatever it was it’s gone now', 'like a candle snuffed out.
pages.name: PIER’S END - (This will end your story!) - I give up', 'theres too many!

pages.content:
Zlip’s face is racked with panic.  “I’m not sure we have enough of the Info-Pads to send a signal to the mothership!”

You ask Zlip what we can do but he just looks at you with those same sad eyes that he had when you first met him which seems so long ago now.  “I don’t know,” he says', 'shaking his head.  But then a resolve comes over him and he grits his teeth.  “We can only try.”

He starts putting the Info-Pads together', 'removing the battery packs and connecting them in a line.  His hands move so fast – inhumanly fast – it’s hard to really see what he’s doing but then he pushes a button and a bright beam starts to pulse from the top of the battery packs.  “That’s it!” he shouts', 'his voice laced with excitement.  The beam burns brighter and brighter and climbs higher and higher until it’s taller than even the zip-wire tower.  “That’s it!  It’s working!”

But now you watch as Zlip’s face collapses from one of happiness to one of utter terror as he holds up a shaking hand and points to something behind you.

You don’t even need to turn around to know it’s Emanax.  You can feel her cold breath on the back of your neck', 'smell the hideous odour emanating from her – a wicked stench of rotten eggs and gone off Pickled Onion flavour crisps and dirty nappies.  Nice.

What should you do? Stay and fight or run and hide?

hint.direction: Thats most of them', 'lets stop there and go back to the pier

pages.content:
You turn around and raise your fists', 'ready to fight', 'but it’s too late.  Emanax leaps right on up and over you', 'landing with a thud in front of Zlip', 'blocking his path.  With one foul swoop', 'she lifts Zlip by the scruff of his neck.

“Finally!” she cries', 'and her voice is a blood-curdling', 'nails-down-chalkboards kind of a screech.  “You thought you could run from me but you were mistaken.  I’m going to look forward to handing you over to the authorities.  They promised me a handsome reward for your capture.”

pages.name: STAY AND FIGHT!

pages.content:
Of course!  The rabbit!  You grab Zlartybox and yank off the silver collar.  Within seconds', 'Zlartybox has transformed into his impressive eight-foot alien body.  Emanax has dropped Zlip and the two of you watch astounded as Zlartybox and Emanax fight to the death', 'taking swings at each other', 'lashing and slashing with their teeth and claws.  With a final roar', 'Zlartybox grabs Emanax’s gun right off her and shoots her in the chest at point blank range.  The miserable creature goes flying', 'right off the pier and crashes into the water below.

“You saved us!” cries Zlip', 'running forward and embracing Zlartybox.  “But I’m afraid I’m going to have to put the collar back on you though', 'for now', 'just in case anyone sees.”  He does so and Zlartybox is once again a white rabbit but then something’s caught his attention.  “Look!  The quantum beacon!”

You hadn’t noticed but in the fight', 'the Info-Pads had been squashed flat', 'their battery packs broken and defunct.  “What are we going to do?” asks Zlip.  “I’m not going to be able to contact the mothership.  They’re going to leave without me!”  He tries again but it’s useless.  Not even the buttons are lighting up now.  He looks as if he’s going to cry but then suddenly his little face lights up.

“It’s OK!  I’ll just have to live here on Planet Earth.  With you!”

You tell him that you don’t think you have enough room in your house unless he lived in the cupboard.

“That’s fine,” he says', 'which isn’t quite the reaction you’d expected.  “I’m sure the cupboard is bigger than my house on my home planet.  It’ll give me the perfect opportunity to study everything you have here.  This is so exciting!”

And he doesn’t stop talking. He goes on and on', 'chatting about how he’s going to go and study this and go and investigate that and how he can’t wait to try spaghetti because it just looks ridiculous and totally inedible and secretly', 'although you’d never tell him this', 'you are quite excited yourself at the prospect of having an alien come and live with you.  And his pet rabbit', 'of course.    

Although you have no idea how you’re going to explain this when you get home. 

But', 'you guess', 'that will have to come later.

For now', 'Zlip wants you to take him to find spaghetti.

hint.direction: Return to the front of the pier

The beam stretches right up into the sky and beyond', 'further than you can see', 'right out into space.  “Come on!  Come on!  This has to work.  It has to!”

You stop yourself from asking what would happen if it doesn’t', 'if Zlip was stranded on Earth.  I mean what would he do?  It’s not like he could live with you.

Could he?

There’s a flash of red light and suddenly standing next to Zlip are two aliens', 'the likes of which you’ve never even imagined before.  You couldn’t even begin to describe them.  Some kind of translucent skin.  Tentacles instead of arms.  And is that…is that their brain…floating around the translucent head like a crouton on the top of soup?  You resist the urge to turn away.

“Mother!” says Zlip.  “Father!”  He rushes over and embraces the two aliens who hug him right back.

One of them – who knows if it’s the mother or father? – says something in a language you don’t understand – a series of whale-like moans.  Zlip shakes his head.  “In a minute.  First', 'there’s something I need to do.”

He rushes over to you and looks you straight in the eyes but his are no longer sad anymore', 'they’re full of a mischievous delight.  “I have to go now but don’t worry', 'I’ll come back', 'you’ll see.  There are hundreds of planets out there for us to explore but this one will always have a special place in my heart.  I want to thank you for everything you’ve done.  I owe you one!”

He pushes a button on his collar and then he’s no longer a human boy', 'he’s an alien boy and now you take a closer look', 'it’s not all that gross after all – it’s actually pretty cool.

Zlip waves one of his five arm/tentacle-things and you wave back.  Another red flash and all of them are gone', 'Zlartybox too', 'leaving you alone on the pier.

But that’s OK.

Because', 'you remind yourself', 'looking up to the sky', 'we’re not alone after all.

pages.name: MAKING A RUN FOR IT

pages.content:
So I’m back', 'your old friend Destiny', 'back in the driver’s seat', 'ready to take the reins', 'so to speak.  Did you miss me?

Who am I kidding', 'of course you did!

But fear not', 'I was there the whole time', 'watching you make the decisions', 'taking the different paths.

This little adventure maybe over', 'for now', 'but there are many more decisions to be made', 'many more paths to take on this twisting', 'turning journey we call life.  Today you were a geologist but who knows what you’ll be tomorrow?

And if you only remember one thing from today I want it to be that the future is a story waiting to be written.

So go out there and start writing it!
